intro: Rhinanthus apuanus, commonly known as the Apuanan yellowtop, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in several regions.
